title: Uninitialized read in exif_process_IFD_in_MAKERNOTE
content:
This bug is present in exif_process_IFD_in_MAKERNOTE method of ext/exif/exif.c file.
Detailed description and steps to reproduce for this bug is present in bug report submitted to php.net.
Bug Report : https://bugs.php.net/bug.php?id=77563
PHP version : 7.1.26
CVE-ID : 2019-9638
Impact
Uninitialized data may leak data from memory.
steps: Identify a PHP application that processes EXIF data from image files (specifically MakerNote tags).
Craft or modify an image file with malformed MakerNote EXIF data that triggers an uninitialized read when processed by the exif_process_IFD_in_MAKERNOTE function.
vuln_description: The vulnerability is an uninitialized read in the exif_process_IFD_in_MAKERNOTE function of PHP's EXIF module. When processing specially crafted image files with malformed MakerNote EXIF data, the function may read uninitialized memory, potentially leading to information disclosure.
reason: The vulnerability requires understanding of EXIF data structures and the specific PHP function's behavior, but does not involve complex interactions or state manipulation. The attack vector is relatively straightforward once the flaw in the EXIF processing is identified.
